marytts.signalproc.process
Class FrameProvider

java.lang.Object
  marytts.signalproc.process.FrameProvider
Direct Known Subclasses:
FrameBasedAnalyser, PitchFrameProvider
public class FrameProvider
extends java.lang.Object

Cut frames out of a given signal, and provide them one by one, optionally applying a processor to the frame. This base implementation provides frames of a fixed length with a fixed shift.

Author:
Marc Schröder
See Also:
PitchFrameProvider

Constructor Detail

FrameProvider

public FrameProvider(DoubleDataSource signal,
                     InlineDataProcessor processor,
                     int frameLength,
                     int frameShift,
                     int samplingRate,
                     boolean stopWhenTouchingEnd)
Initialise a FrameProvider.

Parameters:
signal - the signal source to read from
processor - an optional data processor to apply to the source signal. If null, the original data will be returned.
frameLength - the number of samples in one frame.
frameShift - the number of samples by which to shift the window from one frame analysis to the next; if this is smaller than window.getLength(), frames will overlap.
samplingRate - the number of samples in one second.
stopWhenTouchingEnd - whether or not this frame provider stops when the first frame touches the last input sample. When this is set to true, the last frame will be the first one including the last sample; when this is set to false, the last frame will be the last that still contains any data.
Method Detail

getFrameStartTime

public double getFrameStartTime()
Start position of current frame, in seconds

Returns:
the start time of the last frame returned by getNextFrame(), or a small negative number if no frame has been served yet.

getFrameStartSamples

public long getFrameStartSamples()
Start position of current frame, in samples

Returns:
the start position of the last frame returned by getNextFrame(), or -1 if no frame has been served yet.

getSamplingRate

public int getSamplingRate()

public double getFrameShiftTime()
The amount of time by which one frame is shifted against the next.

The number of samples by which one frame is shifted against the next.

getFrameLengthTime

public double getFrameLengthTime()
The time length of a frame.

getFrameLengthSamples

public int getFrameLengthSamples()
The number of samples in the current frame.

Returns:

stopWhenTouchingEnd

public boolean stopWhenTouchingEnd()
Whether or not this frame provider stops when the first frame touches the last input sample. When this returns true, the last frame will be the first one including the last sample; when this returns false, the last frame will be the last that still contains any data. Defaults to true.

hasMoreData

public boolean hasMoreData()
Whether or not this frameprovider can provide another frame.

validSamplesInFrame

public int validSamplesInFrame()
This tells how many valid samples have been read into the current frame (before applying the optional data processor!).

getNextFrame

public double[] getNextFrame()
Fill the internal double array with the next frame of data. The last frame, if only partially filled with the rest of the signal, is filled up with zeroes. If stopWhenTouchingEnd() returns true, this method will provide not more than a single zero-padded frame at the end of the signal.

Returns:
the next frame on success, null on failure.

getCurrentFrame

public double[] getCurrentFrame()

getData

protected int getData(int nPrefilled)
Read data from input signal into current frame. This base implementation will attempt to fill the frame from the position given in nPrefilled onwards.

Parameters:
nPrefilled - number of valid values at the beginning of frame. These should not be lost or overwritten.
Returns:
the number of new values read into frame at position nPrefilled.

resetInternalTimer

public void resetInternalTimer()
Reset the internal time stamp to 0.

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
                 throws java.lang.Exception
Throws:
java.lang.Exception
